column4: Hi all - I know it's not strictly ubuntu but, I'm having problems getting apache2 vhosts to work using the a2ensite to enable them. The server restarts, but everything ends up showing me my default site. Any ideas?
may be you need to specify you document root properly
thanks - good shout but actually if you set it to a non-existant directory the server throws an error on restart
I am not saying non-existent, i am saying may be it's still /var/www instead of you correct one
Appreciated the response, I went and checked anyway. It's correct - and I tried adding a slash at the end in case that made a difference too ( I seem to recall it mattered to apache < version 2 )
may be you need to paste the content of your vhost file
and how do you try to access the site now?
what's the path for this index.html file you are seeing now?
/web/000catch-all/public/index.html
remove ServerName  82.165.11.156 and retry
and make the catchall vhost after your domain in the file
thanks but still no
you restarted apache?

yes - and I'm getting a relavent error message that, if it was there before, I was being blind to...  [warn] NameVirtualHost *:80 has no VirtualHosts  - but that doesn't help me fix it with my level of knowledge.
I just googled that and found the answer.  Thank you very much for your time helping me.
fine, what's the solution exactly turned to be?
I wonder if I wasn't seeing it with ServerName <ipaddress> in there? anyway, it works.   Where I'd put <VirtualHost *>  in the vhost files, it should have read <VirtualHost *:80>
yes, normally I just copy the default file and modify it so I won't commit such typos
I'd copy pasted from a tutorial blog/website http://articles.slicehost.com/2007/9/27/ubuntu-feisty-apache-virtual-hosts and feel a comment is in order :-)
by the way VirtualHost * is not wrong. It all depends on other config files
in your case because your ports.conf file has NameVirtualHost *:80, you need to specify the port
thanks - this could be because an ssl is configured on this server also (it's a hosted server installed from a "minimal ubuntu x64 10.04" image)
glad everything is OK now, bye
